CONTENT OF A LEGACY
(1) A testator may leave in his or her will one or more specific items of property or a right to a certain person, or impose an obligation on an heir or some other person to whom he or she is leaving something that from the legacy an item of property should be given to a certain person, or a sum of money paid to him or her, or a debt cancelled, or that the heir or legatee should support this person, or do, forbear from doing, or endure something for this person's benefit.
(2) This kind of disposition shall usually not be specified for an heir; this kind of disposition is a legacy; the person it is bequeathed to is a legatee.
